isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Flywheel and Flywheel Housing - Installation - Flywheel Assembly (Manual Transmission)

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, inspect flywheel for cracks or heat checks after resurfacing. Do not install flywheel if damaged or questionable. Flywheel resurfacing information is provided for guidance only. INTERNATIONAL does not assume responsibility for work done by service personnel.

step1.para: Install two guide pins (made locally) in crankshaft flange at approximately 3 o'clock and 9 o'clock.
Align dowel hole in flywheel assembly with crankshaft flange dowel and slide flywheel assembly onto guide pins.
Align reinforcement ring with dowel and slide over guide pins. Make sure lip on outer circumference of ring faces transmission.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, always install new flywheel or flexplate mounting bolts.
To prevent engine damage, do not use anti-seize compounds or grease on new flywheel or flexplate mounting bolts.

step1.para: Install two new M10 x 55 bolts to secure flywheel assembly to crankshaft flange. Remove both guide pins.
Install eight remaining new M10 x 55 bolts.

note.para: New phosphate coated bolts do not require oil before torquing.

step1.para:
Tighten all bolts in sequence shown
to initial torque of 4 N·m (35 lbf·in).

Tighten all bolts in sequence shown
to final torque of 94 N·m (69 lbf·ft).
